message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CV. 

The paper proposes a model for sentence similarity learning, which is a common task in natural language processing (NLP). The model uses word vectors and a two-channel CNN to capture features by decomposing and composing lexical semantics over sentences. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including cs.CL (Computation and Language), cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), and cs.CV (Computer Vision). However, given the focus on NLP and the use of word vectors, cs.CL is the most likely sub-category. The other sub-categories are also possible because they involve related topics such as machine learning, AI, and information retrieval.
